Carousel.title1: French lessons in small groups in Rennes
Carousel.subtitle1: Do you live in Rennes and want to progress in French quickly and while having fun?
Carousel.text1: Join my tailor-made courses, adapted to your level and interests: small class, friendly atmosphere, and meet other expats!
Carousel.subtitle2: Planning to move to the northwest of France?
Carousel.text2: Prepare yourself before your arrival with a local teacher through tailor-made lessons focused on your future region and quickly reach an initial level of French!

About.text1: A qualified teacher who looks like you!
About.text2: Hello, I'm Marion, and I am a French as a Foreign Language teacher in Rennes.
About.text3: Like you, I am an expat! I have lived abroad for a long time, in England, Mexico, and Spain. I speak fluent English, Spanish, and Catalan.
About.text4: Before becoming a teacher, I was a tour guide and I am passionate about the history of Brittany and Normandy (where I am from).
About.text5: As I love teaching and interacting with cultures from around the world, I returned to my studies to become a teacher and obtained the DAEFLE diploma (Diploma of Aptitude for the Teaching of French as a Foreign Language).
About.text6: I started teaching French in a language center in the south of France to expats from all over the world. I loved this experience, which motivated me to open my own school.
About.text7: I returned to Brittany and now I am launching WestFrench Academy, a unique concept in Rennes.

AboutCompany.text73: To learn a language, you need to know its culture! The lessons have a
AboutCompany.text86: The group lessons are held at the
AboutCompany.text88: a futuristic building located just steps from the Charles de Gaulle metro (line A) and Combier (line B). The Colombier district is a testament to 1970s urban planning and is also Rennes' most cultural area. The Maison des Associations hosts concerts, conferences, and dozens of sports and cultural activities throughout the year. The Champs Libre building next door houses the largest library in Rennes, the Brittany Museum, and several community spaces.

Courses.text1: Mini-group Courses in Rennes: Join Our Expat Community
Courses.text2: Integrating into a new country can be a real challenge when you don't master the language. Learn French quickly with a teacher who understands you and make new friends!
Courses.text3: No more overcrowded classes with impersonal and standardized lessons!
Courses.text6: Personalized attention and balanced speaking time.
Courses.text7: Custom lessons based on your interests and goals.
Courses.text11: A local, qualified, and caring teacher.
Courses.text12: Fun and interactive activities using authentic materials.
Courses.text14: Cultural immersion in the history, lifestyle, and Breton and Rennais traditions.
Courses.text15: Regular cultural or leisure outings outside of class.
Courses.text16: Courses of 3 to 8 people, by level (A1, A2, B1, B2)
Courses.text25: Maison des Associations, 6 Cours des Alliés in Rennes.

online.title: Individual Online Courses:
online.text1: Prepare for your arrival in Northwestern France
online.text2: Moving to a French city where you don’t know anyone and can’t communicate in basic situations can be a huge source of stress.
online.text4: French learning journey now from afar
online.text5: with Marion, with custom courses tailored to your needs and your new region.
online.text6: No more useless, decontextualized vocabulary apps.
online.text7: An effective and tailored French program to learn, in just a few hours, how to manage in basic communication situations based on your needs (e.g., introducing yourself, getting to know your neighbors, handling administrative tasks, shopping, ordering at a restaurant, making an appointment, registering by phone, responding to housing ads, applying for a job).
online.text8: Marion, a local, warm, and caring teacher who understands your language.
online.text9: Cultural-focused lessons to learn everything about your future city and/or region (e.g., if you're planning to move to Nantes, you’ll explore its history, local cuisine, cultural venues, lifestyle, as well as nearby villages and vineyards).
online.text10: If you plan to move to Rennes, you can start online courses with me right now, and once you arrive, you can join our in-person group courses to continue progressing with a teacher you already know and meet other expats to integrate quickly!
